topic.term: Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs

metadata.title: Tree gibbs sampler: Identifying conserved motifs without aligning orthologous sequences
metadata.abstract: Summary: Tree Gibbs Sampler is a software for identifying motifs by simultaneously using the motif overrepresentation property and the motif evolutionary conservation property. It identifies motifs without depending on pre-aligned orthologous sequences, which makes it useful for the extraction of regulatory elements in multiple genomes of both closely related and distant species. © 2007 The Author(s).

description: Software for identifying motifs by simultaneously using the motif overrepresentation property and the motif evolutionary conservation property. It identifies motifs without depending on pre-aligned orthologous sequences, which makes it useful for the extraction of regulatory elements in multiple genomes of both closely related and distant species.
name: TreeGibbsSampler
